analyzed: da ni ya'i yi ge la sogs pa dgu'i las rgyud thams cad du bstan par bzhed pa gsungs pa /

analyzed: ka yig la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas phung po dang khams ka'i yi ge rnams te /

analyzed: sngon du bshad pa'i yi ge'i rnam 'gyur gyis so //

original: yan lag dgu brjod pa po zhes bya ba'i mdo dang / dbyangs dang / lung bstan pa dang / tshigs su cad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang / sdeb sbyor dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: yan lag dgu brjod pa po zhes bya ba'i mdo dang / dbyangs dang / lung bstan pa dang / tshigs su cad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang / sdeb sbyor dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang /

analyzed: chos rmad du byung ba nye bar ston pa'o //

analyzed: ji srid le'u lnga bcu'i bar du'o //

original: de ltar slar yang rgyud thams cad kyi yi ge le'u gang las byung ba de gsungs pa /

original: sdom pa rgya mtsho mkha' 'gro skyes //
analyzed: sdom pa rgya mtsho mkha' 'gro skyes //

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin gnyis dmigs pa de'i dbus las 'byung ba @283a * //
translated: that from the middle of the objective support of those two samadhis, the vow, ocean, dakini, and bornüîΩ arise.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni des de ltar 'di rnams kyi sgrub thabs gsungs pa /

original: nam mkha' las byung rgyu mtshan can //
analyzed: nam mkha' las byung rgyu mtshan can //

analyzed: bdud rtsi sku la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the nectar body.

original: sman rnams rgyun du yod pa ste //
analyzed: sman rnams rgyun du yod pa ste //
translated: The medicines are always present,

original: dngos gyur yang dag rgyun du ba //
analyzed: dngos gyur yang dag rgyun du ba //
translated: truly existent, and continuous.

original: mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho'i sku chen po //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho'i sku chen po //
translated: The great body of the ocean of dakinis,

original: sangs rgyas gzugs kyi rgyu can te ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzugs kyi rgyu can te ;
translated: the cause of the form of the Buddha,

original: / bde mchog la sogs pa'i ming can //
analyzed: / bde mchog la sogs pa'i ming can //
translated: has the name of supreme bliss and so forth.

original: de dag la rtag bdag phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: de dag la rtag bdag phyag 'tshal //

analyzed: da ni sgrub thabs la 'jug par bya'o //

original: sgrub thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: sgrub thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: By means of achievement and so on.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i nang du zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i rgyud du ji ltar bshad pa de 'dir yang 'jug par mdzad pa'o //

translated: In the space-like interior means that just as it is explained in the Space-like Tantra, here also it is to be applied.

original: 'dir sngon du le'u bcva lnga par bshad pa'i rim pas ting nge 'dzin dmigs te khang pa brtsegs pa la sogs pa rdzogs par byas nas de'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa la de'i lte bar h'um gi yi ge ye shes kyi sa bon bsams nas des
analyzed: 'dir sngon du le'u bcva lnga par bshad pa'i rim pas ting nge 'dzin dmigs te khang pa brtsegs pa la sogs pa rdzogs par byas nas de'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa la de'i lte bar h'um gi yi ge ye shes kyi sa bon bsams nas des
translated: Here, first, by the process explained in chapter fifteen, one visualizes the samadhi, and having completed the palace and so on, in the center of that, on an eight-petaled lotus, one imagines the seed syllable of gnosis, the syllable hum.

original: kyang sangs rgyas kyi gzugs ji ltar gsal ba ste rang gi bdag nyid phyag gnyis pa zhal gcig pa rdo rje skyil mo drung gis legs par bzhugs pa de'i mdog ni dkar po la sogs pa'i gzugs zhi ba la sogs pa rang gi 'dod pas so //
analyzed: kyang sangs rgyas kyi gzugs ji ltar gsal ba ste rang gi bdag nyid phyag gnyis pa zhal gcig pa rdo rje skyil mo drung gis legs par bzhugs pa de'i mdog ni dkar po la sogs pa'i gzugs zhi ba la sogs pa rang gi 'dod pas so //
translated: From that, one's own form appears clearly as a Buddha, with two arms, one face, and seated well in the vajra posture. One's complexion is white and so on, and one's form is peaceful and so on, as one wishes.

original: de'i shar gyi 'dab mar sku'i rgya mtsho sku mdog dkar po'o //
analyzed: de'i shar gyi 'dab mar sku'i rgya mtsho sku mdog dkar po'o //
translated: On the eastern petal, the ocean of body is white.

original: byang du ser sna rgya mtsho sku mdog ljang gu'o //üîΩnub tu 'dod chags rgya mtsho sku mdog dmar po'o //
analyzed: byang du ser sna rgya mtsho sku mdog ljang gu'o // nub tu 'dod chags rgya mtsho sku mdog dmar po'o //
translated: In the north is the green ocean of avarice.üîΩIn the west is the red ocean of passion.

original: lhor phrag dog rgya mtsho sku mdog ser po ste /
analyzed: lhor phrag dog rgya mtsho sku mdog ser po ste /
translated: In the south is the yellow ocean of envy.

original: phyogs bzhir rnam par bsgoms nas 'dir 'khrugs pas grva bzhi rnams kyi padma'i 'dab ma la thob pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: phyogs bzhir rnam par bsgoms nas 'dir 'khrugs pas grva bzhi rnams kyi padma'i 'dab ma la thob pa bzhi ste /
translated: Having visualized them in the four directions, here they are agitated by the churning stick, and the four ladles are on the lotus petals in the four corners.

original: rgya mtsho bzhi'i gzugs zhes bya ba ni bi mu shu ra'i bdud rtsi rnams so //
analyzed: rgya mtsho bzhi'i gzugs zhes bya ba ni bi mu shu ra'i bdud rtsi rnams so //
translated: The ‚Äúforms of the four oceans‚Äù are the ambrosias of the four oceans.

original: kun du 'gro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi sbyor pas dngos po thams cad lus kyi khams rnams kyi nang du gyur par bya'o //
analyzed: kun du 'gro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi sbyor pas dngos po thams cad lus kyi khams rnams kyi nang du gyur par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUniversal‚Äù means that by the yoga of concentration, all things should be transformed into the elements of the body.

original: 'di ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i //
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i //
translated: This is the great-bliss wheel.

original: de'i phyi rol du thugs kyi 'khor lo gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du thugs kyi 'khor lo gsungs pa /
translated: Outside of that, the mind wheel is taught:

original: rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩde'i shar gyi rtsibs la rdo rje rgya mtsho'o //üîΩbyang du rin chen rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / de'i shar gyi rtsibs la rdo rje rgya mtsho'o // byang du rin chen rgya mtsho'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe yogi‚Äù and so on.üîΩOn its eastern spoke is Vajra Ocean.üîΩIn the north is Jewel Ocean.

original: nub tu padma rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: nub tu padma rgya mtsho'o //
translated: In the west is Lotus Ocean.

original: lhor sna tshogs rgya mtsho ste g-yon skor ro //
analyzed: lhor sna tshogs rgya mtsho ste g-yon skor ro //
translated: In the south is the ocean of variety.

original: slar yang grva bzhir g-yas skor du me la sogs pa'i gsungs pa mer rnal 'byor rgya mtsho'o //üîΩbden bral du ye shes rgya @283b mtsho'o //
analyzed: slar yang grva bzhir g-yas skor du me la sogs pa'i gsungs pa mer rnal 'byor rgya mtsho'o // bden bral du ye shes rgya @283b mtsho'o //
translated: Again, in the four corners, beginning with the right, in the fire direction, is the ocean of yoga.üîΩIn the northwest is the ocean of intuition.

original: de kho na nyid rgya mtsho rlung du'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid rgya mtsho rlung du'o //
translated: In the wind direction is the ocean of reality.

original: dbang ldan du thar ba rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan du thar ba rgya mtsho'o //
translated: In the northeast is the ocean of liberation.

original: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa brgyad rim pa ji ltar shes par bya ste //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa brgyad rim pa ji ltar shes par bya ste //
translated: Thus, the eight oceans of form and so forth should be known in order.

original: de nyid bshad pa thugs kyi 'khor lo'i phyi rol du gsung gi 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa thugs kyi 'khor lo'i phyi rol du gsung gi 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of that is that the wheel of speech is on the outside of the wheel of mind, with eight spokes.

original: de la shar gyi rtsibs su gzugs kyi rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: de la shar gyi rtsibs su gzugs kyi rgya mtsho'o //
translated: On that, in the east is the ocean of form.

original: byang du sgra'i rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: byang du sgra'i rgya mtsho'o //
translated: In the north is the ocean of sound.

original: nub tu dri'i rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: nub tu dri'i rgya mtsho'o //
translated: In the west is the ocean of smell.

original: lhor ro'i rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: lhor ro'i rgya mtsho'o //
translated: In the south is the ocean of taste.

original: me la sogs pa'i grva bzhi g-yas kyi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin reg bya rgya mtsho dang chos rgya mtsho dang yid rgya mtsho dang thugs rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i grva bzhi g-yas kyi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin reg bya rgya mtsho dang chos rgya mtsho dang yid rgya mtsho dang thugs rgya mtsho'o //
translated: In the four corners beginning with the right, in the fire direction and so forth, are the oceans of touch, phenomena, mind, and gnosis, respectively.

original: slar yang de'i phyi rol du sku'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa de'i shar gyi rtsibs las gzhi rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: slar yang de'i phyi rol du sku'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa de'i shar gyi rtsibs las gzhi rgya mtsho'o //

original: byang du nam mkha' rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: byang du nam mkha' rgya mtsho'o //
translated: In the north is the ocean of the sky.

original: nub tu lce rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: nub tu lce rgya mtsho'o //
translated: In the west is the ocean of the tongue.

original: lhor rna ba rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: lhor rna ba rgya mtsho'o //
translated: In the south is the ocean of the ear.

original: ni'i yi ges yang me la sogs pa'i grvar sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'i rgya mtsho dang / bzang po rgya mtsho dang / ye shes rgya mtsho rnams so //
analyzed: ni'i yi ges yang me la sogs pa'i grvar sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'i rgya mtsho dang / bzang po rgya mtsho dang / ye shes rgya mtsho rnams so //
translated: In the corners beginning with the southeast, the syllable ni indicates the ocean of Sarvanƒ´vara·πáavi·π£kambhin, the ocean of BhadrapƒÅla, and the ocean of J√±ƒÅnaketu.

original: de bzhin du shar la sogs pa'i sgo rnams su g-yon skor gyis gsungs pa de la shar gyi sgor glang po che rgya mtsho dang / byang du rta rgya mtsho dang / nub tu seng ge rgya mtsho dang / lhor ma he rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shar la sogs pa'i sgo rnams su g-yon skor gyis gsungs pa de la shar gyi sgor glang po che rgya mtsho dang / byang du rta rgya mtsho dang / nub tu seng ge rgya mtsho dang / lhor ma he rgya mtsho'o //

original: slar yang me la sogs pa'i grva bzhi rnams su sgyu ma rgya mtsho dang / bden bral du rmi lam rgya mtsho dang ; rlung du gsal snang rgya mtsho dang / dbang ldan du snang ba rgya mtsho'o //

analyzed: gzhan thams cad rtogs par sla'o // 'di ni dpal mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho thams cad gsang ba'i le'u lnga bcu bar gzhu 'gengs pa'i rim pas mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa'i ming gi yi ge'i sbyor ba dang de bzhin du aa'i yi ge la sogs pa'i yi ge thams cad ksha'i yi ge'i mtha' rnams

original: de zhes bya ba ni de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni de de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: The that refers to that which was just explained.

original: gang du sngom ba'i sgras bshad pa gsungs pa 'dod chags 'dod chags med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste r'a'i yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: gang du sngom ba'i sgras bshad pa gsungs pa 'dod chags 'dod chags med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste r'a'i yi ge'i don to //
translated: The verse beginning Attachment and nonattachment explains the term commitment, which is the meaning of the syllable ra.

original: de ltar 'dod chags ni mchog tu bde ba chen po'i byang chub kyi sems kun nas skye 'gro'i don byed pa po'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags ni mchog tu bde ba chen po'i byang chub kyi sems kun nas skye 'gro'i don byed pa po'o //
translated: Thus, attachment is the supreme great bliss, the awakening mind that is the agent of benefiting migrating beings.

original: 'dod chags med ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa chos kyi dbyings kyi nang du son pas rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid brjod du med pa dang 'dres pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub bo //
analyzed: 'dod chags med ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa chos kyi dbyings kyi nang du son pas rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid brjod du med pa dang 'dres pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub bo //
translated: Nonattachment is the awakening of the bodhisattvas, who are absorbed in the expanse of reality, the aspect of natural luminosity, and are inseparable from the inexpressible reality of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir na sdom pa ste rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba skye 'gro'i gzugs can dang de'i rang bzhin zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sdom pa ste rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba skye 'gro'i gzugs can dang de'i rang bzhin zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, the restraint is free from all conceptual thoughts, and is the nature of the forms of living beings.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni skye 'gro'i gzugs kyis te chos thams cad kyi sdom pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni skye 'gro'i gzugs kyis te chos thams cad kyi sdom pa'o //
translated: By that very thing means by the forms of living beings, the restraint of all phenomena.

original: sngon gyi spyod pas zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i sna tshogs pa'i sbyor ba rnams su'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi spyod pas zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i sna tshogs pa'i sbyor ba rnams su'o //
translated: By the conduct of the past means in the various applications of the explanation.

original: de ltar bsdams pas gang du 'gro ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar bsdams pas gang du 'gro ba gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, having been restrained, it is said where one goes:

original: nam mkhar 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkhar 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moving in space, and so on.

original: bee yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: bee yi ge'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the syllable vai.

original: nam mkhar 'gro zhes bya ba na nam mkha' la 'gro zhing sdod pa ste sku gsum rnams yang dag par bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkhar 'gro zhes bya ba na nam mkha' la 'gro zhing sdod pa ste sku gsum rnams yang dag par bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Moving in space means moving and abiding in space, the perfect abode of the three bodies.

original: gnas der gnas pas chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i rang bzhin du ste de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: gnas der gnas pas chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i rang bzhin du ste de de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: Abiding in that place, the nature of phenomena, and so on, means that nature of that, that is explained in that way.

original: der de ltar 'gro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ri li yi ge'i don gyis de 'gro bas na 'gro ba ste de'i chos rnams kyi gang gi tshe sems rdzu 'phrul gyi gzugs kyi dbus su rang nyid kyis thim pa ste 'dis lhan cig skyes
analyzed: der de ltar 'gro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ri li yi ge'i don gyis de 'gro bas na 'gro ba ste de'i chos rnams kyi gang gi tshe sems rdzu 'phrul gyi gzugs kyi dbus su rang nyid kyis thim pa ste 'dis lhan cig skyes
translated: The meaning of the syllable ri is to go, and since that is so, it is a goer. When the mind dissolves into the middle of the form of the magical emanation, one's own nature is the connate gnosis.

original: zhes bya ba dang byang chub dang ldan pa'i bar du don gsal ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang byang chub dang ldan pa'i bar du don gsal ba'o //
translated: There, ‚Äúhaving gone in that way‚Äù and so on clarifies the meaning of the syllable li. Since one goes there, it is a destination. When one‚Äôs mind dissolves into the middle of the form of the magical body, one‚Äôs own self, this is the meaning of ‚Äúcoemergent‚Äù and so on up to ‚Äúendowed with awakening.‚Äù

original: de'i yang na'i yi ge'i don gyis gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i yang na'i yi ge'i don gyis gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of the syllable na is clarified:

original: @285b ting nge 'dzin min zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: @285b ting nge 'dzin min zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNot samƒÅdhi‚Äù and so on.

original: srid gsum gang gi thim pa zhes bya ba ni dpe'i ming lhan cig skyes pa de thob pas na de'i ting nge 'dzin gyi skad cig ste dus mi shes pas dbye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: srid gsum gang gi thim pa zhes bya ba ni dpe'i ming lhan cig skyes pa de thob pas na de'i ting nge 'dzin gyi skad cig ste dus mi shes pas dbye ba med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe dissolution of the three existences‚Äù is the name of the example. Since one obtains the coemergent, the moment of that samƒÅdhi is not known, and therefore it is indivisible.

original: de ltar yin yang de nyid dus te byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa 'khor bar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag gis 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yin yang de nyid dus te byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa 'khor bar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag gis 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: Although that is so, it should be understood that it is the time of the bodhisattvas and so forth, in the cycle of existence, as the characteristic of the arising of the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: de ltar skye ba dang thim pa'i dbye bas sdom pa 'dod pa'i don thams cad ster ba po ste /
analyzed: de ltar skye ba dang thim pa'i dbye bas sdom pa 'dod pa'i don thams cad ster ba po ste /
translated: Thus, by the division of arising and dissolving, the vow is the bestower of all desired aims.

original: lus can gzhan rnams kyi min pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: lus can gzhan rnams kyi min pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is not for other embodied beings, but for the yogis, is the thought.

original: de yang de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: de yang de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas de de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: And that is explained in that way, beginning with ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: slar yang rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyi phyi rol du bsdams pas nang gi bdag nyid rnams su sdom pa 'byung ba dbyangs dang zhag la sogs pa bstan par bzhed nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyi phyi rol du bsdams pas nang gi bdag nyid rnams su sdom pa 'byung ba dbyangs dang zhag la sogs pa bstan par bzhed nas gsungs pa /
translated: Again, intending to teach the external and internal natures that arise from the vow, which is the external restraint of the various kinds, he says,

original: nang bdag nyid du dbyangs zhes bya ba la sogs pas de dngos po ma lus pa bsdams pas bde ba chen po rnams su de 'char ba ni slar yang sdom pa 'char ba'o //
analyzed: nang bdag nyid du dbyangs zhes bya ba la sogs pas de dngos po ma lus pa bsdams pas bde ba chen po rnams su de 'char ba ni slar yang sdom pa 'char ba'o //

original: des zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir rab tu ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir rab tu ma chad pa'o //

original: ci de'i mdor bstan du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci de'i mdor bstan du gsungs pa /

original: mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: 'tsho ba'i gzugs kyi cha shas zhes bya ba ni byin gyis rlob pa po dbyangs bcu gnyis rnams kyis so //

original: r'a si zhes bya ba la sogs pas chu srin la sogs pa bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: r'a si zhes bya ba la sogs pas chu srin la sogs pa bcu gnyis so //
translated: RƒÅsi, etc. are the twelve, Makara, etc.

original: rgyu skar thams cad ces bya ba ni re re'i rkang pa la sogs pas gnyis rnams bcu gnyis rnams kyis nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: rgyu skar thams cad ces bya ba ni re re'i rkang pa la sogs pas gnyis rnams bcu gnyis rnams kyis nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
translated: All the lunar mansions, etc. are the twenty-seven, two by two, with the twelve feet, etc.

original: de rnams dang ldan par 'char ro //
analyzed: de rnams dang ldan par 'char ro //
translated: They arise in union with those.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma'i cha shas zhes bya ba ni srog dang thur sel dang rdul dang byang chub kyi sems kha 'og dang steng du bltas pa ste 'dir 'og mtshan mo la steng nyin mo'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma'i cha shas zhes bya ba ni srog dang thur sel dang rdul dang byang chub kyi sems kha 'og dang steng du bltas pa ste 'dir 'og mtshan mo la steng nyin mo'o //
translated: The parts of the moon and sun are the downward and upward facing vital wind, downward voiding, semen, and bodhicitta. Here, the lower is night and the upper is day.

original: 'dis dus kyi dbye ba dang gnas kyi dbye ba dang bstan par bzhed pa brtan pa dang g-yo ba gnyis zhes bya ba ni rgyu skar rnams ni brtan pa'o //

original: r'a si ni g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: r'a si ni g-yo ba'o //
translated: RƒÅhu is moving.

original: de ni g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i dbye ba bcu gnyis kyi bar du gnyis gnyis so //
analyzed: de ni g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i dbye ba bcu gnyis kyi bar du gnyis gnyis so //
translated: That is divided into twelve, two for each of the right and left.

original: de'i phyir srog ces bya ba ni bum pa dang lug dang 'khrig pa dang seng ge dang srang dang gzhu ste //
analyzed: de'i phyir srog ces bya ba ni bum pa dang lug dang 'khrig pa dang seng ge dang srang dang gzhu ste //

original: g-yon par yang ba dang rgyal bar byed pa ste rab tu 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon par yang ba dang rgyal bar byed pa ste rab tu 'bab pa'o //

original: 'on kyang lus kyi steng rtsa ba la 'og yal ga ste gang yal ga las steng du 'dzin par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang lus kyi steng rtsa ba la 'og yal ga ste gang yal ga las steng du 'dzin par byed pas so //
translated: However, the upper root of the body is below, and the branches are above, because they hold the upper body.

original: de ltar chu srin dang nya dang khyu mchog dang ka rka ta dang bu mo dang sdig pa rnams te g-yas par zung ring po dang ma rgyal ba 'og tu 'bab pa'i rtsa bar ro //
analyzed: de ltar chu srin dang nya dang khyu mchog dang ka rka ta dang bu mo dang sdig pa rnams te g-yas par zung ring po dang ma rgyal ba 'og tu 'bab pa'i rtsa bar ro //
translated: Thus, the Makara, the Fish, the Bull, the Crab, the Maiden, and the Scorpion are on the right, and the pair of the Dragon and the Ram are below the foundation of the falling A≈õvinƒ´.

original: slar yang der gnas nas 'char ro //

translated: In that way, the nature of the self, the king of the ≈öƒÅkyas, and so on, is explained by the Buddha. Listen with a one-pointed mind, O VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, and so on.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: He said this:

original: lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The body, and so on.

original: rtsa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'dir lus kyi khams kyi rab tu dbye ba'i rtsar bshad de so dang sen mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'dir lus kyi khams kyi rab tu dbye ba'i rtsar bshad de so dang sen mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The channels are explained here as the divisions of the body elements, such as teeth, nails, and so on.

original: de rnams kyi yan lag sum cu zhes bya ba ni ba thag gi snal ma'i gzugs ma rnams srog 'bab pa'i rtsa chen po ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi yan lag sum cu zhes bya ba ni ba thag gi snal ma'i gzugs ma rnams srog 'bab pa'i rtsa chen po ste /
translated: Their thirty branches are the great channels that flow with life-force.

original: gtso bo bcug nyis nyid ces bya ba ni dbyangs bcu gnyis rnams kyi a'i yi ge la sogs pa bcu gnyis rnams kyi bgrod pa dkar po'i phyogs rnams su rkang pa g-yon pa'i mthe bong dang rkang pa'i bo la gong dang byin pa dang pus mo dag tu
analyzed: gtso bo bcug nyis nyid ces bya ba ni dbyangs bcu gnyis rnams kyi a'i yi ge la sogs pa bcu gnyis rnams kyi bgrod pa dkar po'i phyogs rnams su rkang pa g-yon pa'i mthe bong dang rkang pa'i bo la gong dang byin pa dang pus mo dag tu
translated: The so-called ‚Äútwelve principal ones‚Äù are the twelve vowels, a, etc., which are the white lunar fortnights, in the left foot, the top of the foot, the calf, and the knee.

original: gsang ba dang rlig pa dang mtshan khung dang lag dar dang dpung pa dang thal gong dang dpral ba'i steng dang dbus su yang ste bcu gnyis so //üîΩde bzhin du nag po'i phyogs la dbyangs ring po @290a * //
analyzed: gsang ba dang rlig pa dang mtshan khung dang lag dar dang dpung pa dang thal gong dang dpral ba'i steng dang dbus su yang ste bcu gnyis so // de bzhin du nag po'i phyogs la dbyangs ring po @290a * //
translated: They are also in the secret place, the testicles, the armpits, the hands, the shoulders, the chest, the forehead, and the middle, making twelve.

original: bcu gnyis rnams lus kyi g-yas dpral ba'i dbus nas brtsams nas rkang pa'i mthe bo de nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis rnams lus kyi g-yas dpral ba'i dbus nas brtsams nas rkang pa'i mthe bo de nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Similarly, in the dark lunar fortnights, the twelve long vowels are in the right side of the body, beginning from the middle of the forehead to the toe, making twenty-four.

original: de rnams las yang gtso bo snying po mchog dgu zhes bya ba ste rtsa dgu snying po gtso po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams las yang gtso bo snying po mchog dgu zhes bya ba ste rtsa dgu snying po gtso po zhes bya'o //
translated: From among those, the so-called ‚Äúnine principal ones‚Äù are the nine principal channels called ‚ÄúnƒÅdƒ´s.‚Äù

original: drug gnyis zhes bya ba ni nyi ma bcu gnyis ma bcu gnyis rnams kyis te de deng zhin no //
analyzed: drug gnyis zhes bya ba ni nyi ma bcu gnyis ma bcu gnyis rnams kyis te de deng zhin no //
translated: The six pairs are the twelve suns, and the twelve are the twelve months.

original: rtsa dgu rnams kyi nyis 'gyur gyi tshigs gsungs pa sna zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rtsa dgu rnams kyi nyis 'gyur gyi tshigs gsungs pa sna zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The verse beginning with nose refers to the double of the nineteen.

original: nyi ma'i tshad ces bya ba 'chi ba'i dus su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i tshad ces bya ba 'chi ba'i dus su shes par bya'o //
translated: The measure of the sun is to be known at the time of death.

original: de'i tshe 'khor lo dus kyi bdag nyid can //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor lo dus kyi bdag nyid can //
translated: At that time, the wheel is the nature of time.

original: zhes bya ba ste de'i phyir sa la 'khor lo dum bu bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid bzhag par bya ste dum bu gnyis pa'am gsum pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste de'i phyir sa la 'khor lo dum bu bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid bzhag par bya ste dum bu gnyis pa'am gsum pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the wheel should be placed on the ground with the nature of twelve segments, two or three segments.

original: der angka bzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: der angka bzhag par bya ste /
translated: The mark should be placed there.

original: de ltar nyi ma drug ces bya ba phyin ci log gis 'khor lo dbus mar dum bu ba thog ma nas brtsams nas dum bu drug gi bar du bdun dang brgyad dang dgu dang bcu dang bcu gcig dang bcu gnyis kyi aang ka rnams so /
analyzed: de ltar nyi ma drug ces bya ba phyin ci log gis 'khor lo dbus mar dum bu ba thog ma nas brtsams nas dum bu drug gi bar du bdun dang brgyad dang dgu dang bcu dang bcu gcig dang bcu gnyis kyi aang ka rnams so /
translated: Thus, the six suns are the seven, eight, nine, ten, eleven, and twelve marks of the first segment up to the sixth segment in the center of the wheel, beginning from the first, in the reverse order.

original: lhag ma drug po rnams su ji ltar gsungs pa rnams kyi lo gsum la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i aang ka rnams bzhag par bya'o /
analyzed: lhag ma drug po rnams su ji ltar gsungs pa rnams kyi lo gsum la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i aang ka rnams bzhag par bya'o /
translated: The remaining six houses should be set up with the results of the years, and so on, as they are described.

original: slar yang de'i phyi rol du 'khor lo gnyis par ji ltar bshad pa'i rim pas 'bras bu dang rgyu can yongs su bzhag pas rgyu mtshan la sogs pa nas brtsams nas 'chi rtags mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang de'i phyi rol du 'khor lo gnyis par ji ltar bshad pa'i rim pas 'bras bu dang rgyu can yongs su bzhag pas rgyu mtshan la sogs pa nas brtsams nas 'chi rtags mtshon par bya'o //
translated: Again, outside of that, in the second wheel, one should set up the results and causes as they are described, and the signs of death should be indicated beginning from the reason and so on.

original: bar rnams kyis rab tu bshad ces bya ba ni sngon pa dang gzhan ma drug drug gnyis gnyis kyis te grangs bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: bar rnams kyis rab tu bshad ces bya ba ni sngon pa dang gzhan ma drug drug gnyis gnyis kyis te grangs bcu gnyis so //
translated: The ‚Äúintermediate ones‚Äù are the first and the other six, two by two, that is, twelve in number.

original: de ltar nyi ma dang lo'i rim pas yongs su sbyangs nas bdun cu rtsag nyis rjes su rim pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar nyi ma dang lo'i rim pas yongs su sbyangs nas bdun cu rtsag nyis rjes su rim pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Having thus refined by the order of the days and years, ‚Äúthe seventy-two in order,‚Äù

original: de ltar gnas bcu gnyis rnams su ji lta ba'i rim pas drug dang bcu gnyis dang bco brgyad dang de zhin du nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang bcu dang sum cu rtsa drug dang bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis dang bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad dang lnga bcu rtsa bzhi dang drug
analyzed: de ltar gnas bcu gnyis rnams su ji lta ba'i rim pas drug dang bcu gnyis dang bco brgyad dang de zhin du nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang bcu dang sum cu rtsa drug dang bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis dang bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad dang lnga bcu rtsa bzhi dang drug
translated: Thus, in the twelve topics, there are six, twelve, eighteen, twenty-four, ten, thirty-six, forty-two, forty-eight, fifty-four, sixty, and sixty-four.üîΩ

original: cu dang drug cu rtsa drug dang bdun cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: cu dang drug cu rtsa drug dang bdun cu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, in the twelve locations, in the order of the sequence of the way things are, there are six, twelve, eighteen, twenty-four, ten, thirty-six, forty-two, forty-eight, fifty-four, sixty, sixty-six, and seventy-two.

original: de ltar nyis 'gyur dang sum 'gyur dang / bzhi 'gyur dang / lnga 'gyur gyi bar du zhes bya bzhi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyis 'gyur dang sum 'gyur dang / bzhi 'gyur dang / lnga 'gyur gyi bar du zhes bya bzhi nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, there are four certainties, from the twofold, threefold, fourfold, and fivefold.

original: de ltar gzhan pa sngon dang gzhan pa thams cad kyi 'chi ba bslu ste go sla'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan pa sngon dang gzhan pa thams cad kyi 'chi ba bslu ste go sla'o //
translated: Thus, the death of all others is averted.

original: da ni 'di rnams kyi 'chi pa'i mtshan ma las byung ba'i bslu ba'i man ngag gi rab tu spyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'di rnams kyi 'chi pa'i mtshan ma las byung ba'i bslu ba'i man ngag gi rab tu spyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the application of the instruction for averting the signs of death is explained:

original: @290b 'di rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: @290b 'di rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThese‚Äù and so on.

original: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba ni rjes su gnas par bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba ni rjes su gnas par bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should meditate‚Äù means one should follow.

original: rdo rje 'od kyi 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ming gi yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'od kyi 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ming gi yi ge rnams so //
translated: The syllables of the name of Vajraprabha, which will be explained.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He says just that:

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Vajra, etc.

original: de ltar badzra'i yi ge gnyis kyi don to //
analyzed: de ltar badzra'i yi ge gnyis kyi don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the two syllables vajra.

original: rdo rje'i lam ni aa wa dh'u t'i'i lam nas son pa ste srog gi tshogs thams cad do //
analyzed: rdo rje'i lam ni aa wa dh'u t'i'i lam nas son pa ste srog gi tshogs thams cad do //
translated: Having come by the path of the vajra, i.e., the path of the avadh≈´tƒ´, i.e., all the collections of life-winds,

original: steng dang 'og tu bltas par gyur pas rtsa thams cad dgug pa ste /
analyzed: steng dang 'og tu bltas par gyur pas rtsa thams cad dgug pa ste /
translated: looking up and down, i.e., drawing in all the channels,

original: bcu gnyis kyi mtha' dpral ba'i mthar thug pa dang aa wa dh'u t'i'i nang du'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis kyi mtha' dpral ba'i mthar thug pa dang aa wa dh'u t'i'i nang du'o //
translated: up to the end of the twelve, i.e., up to the end of the forehead, and in the interior of the avadh≈´tƒ´.

original: sangs rgyas rjes dran zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i don gyi phan pa'i rgyur snying rje la sogs pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes dran zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i don gyi phan pa'i rgyur snying rje la sogs pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: The recollection of the Buddha, i.e., with a mind of compassion, etc., for the sake of the benefit of the world.

original: sems can gyi 'du shes 'dis de'i rnam par za bas de de bzhin du bshad do /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'du shes 'dis de'i rnam par za bas de de bzhin du bshad do /
translated: By this perception of sentient beings, he eats in that form, and so he is explained as such.

original: 'di'i bya ba dang byed pa'i 'bras bu gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di'i bya ba dang byed pa'i 'bras bu gsungs pa /
translated: The result of the action and the agent of this is stated:

original: 'og ces bya ba las sogs pa ste pra bha'i yi ge gnyis kyi don to //
analyzed: 'og ces bya ba las sogs pa ste pra bha'i yi ge gnyis kyi don to //
translated: Below, etc. The meaning of the two syllables prabha.

original: gsang sngags chen po zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' bas 'od gsal ba las gnas nas rnal 'byor pa dngos po thams cad kyi gzugs rnams su 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: gsang sngags chen po zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' bas 'od gsal ba las gnas nas rnal 'byor pa dngos po thams cad kyi gzugs rnams su 'jug par byed do //
translated: The great mantra is the clear light from the innate joy, and the yogi/ni enters into all the forms of things from that abode.

original: slar yang ba'i yi ge la sogs pa re re'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang ba'i yi ge la sogs pa re re'i don gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the meaning of each of the letters of the mantra is stated:

original: rtsa 'gengs par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni dbu ma bkang bar gyur pas rtsa thams cad dgang bar byas te /
analyzed: rtsa 'gengs par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni dbu ma bkang bar gyur pas rtsa thams cad dgang bar byas te /
translated: The filling is the filling of all the channels by the filling of the central channel.

original: des dngos po thams cad ye shes kyi rnam par gnas te ji ltar srog dang sems 'bab pa de bzhin du thams cad du ba thag gi bgrod pa de thob par bya'o //
analyzed: des dngos po thams cad ye shes kyi rnam par gnas te ji ltar srog dang sems 'bab pa de bzhin du thams cad du ba thag gi bgrod pa de thob par bya'o //
translated: By that, all things abide in the form of gnosis, and just as the life-force and mind descend, so too, one should attain the descent of all things.

original: de gnas pas sems can gyi ris la sogs pa 'jog pas ni dza'i yi ge'i don gyis te chos kyi bdag med pa skyed do //
analyzed: de gnas pas sems can gyi ris la sogs pa 'jog pas ni dza'i yi ge'i don gyis te chos kyi bdag med pa skyed do //
translated: By the meaning of the letter j, the abode of sentient beings, etc., one generates the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de yis kyang 'chad pas dza'i yi ge'i kun du sbyor ba'i ri'i yi ge'i don gyis sangs rgyas nyid du 'tshed pa sta /
analyzed: de yis kyang 'chad pas dza'i yi ge'i kun du sbyor ba'i ri'i yi ge'i don gyis sangs rgyas nyid du 'tshed pa sta /
translated: By that, one cooks, and by the meaning of the letter r of the conjunction of the letter j, one cooks in buddhahood.

original: gang zag rnams la 'tshed pa ni sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams so so'i re rer ro //
analyzed: gang zag rnams la 'tshed pa ni sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams so so'i re rer ro //
translated: The cooking of the individuals is the various sentient beings, each one.

original: de gnyis kyis ni chos kyi bdag med pa dang gang zag gi bdag med pa'i snying rje'i dbang gis gnas pa rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis ni chos kyi bdag med pa dang gang zag gi bdag med pa'i snying rje'i dbang gis gnas pa rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang ngo //
translated: By those two, the bodhisattvas, who abide by the power of compassion for the objective selflessness and the personal selflessness, respectively.

original: rab tu gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas pra'i yi ge'i don gyis te des nal 'byor pa rnams kyi sems 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas pra'i yi ge'i don gyis te des nal 'byor pa rnams kyi sems 'chi ba ste /
translated: By the syllable pra, which begins with ‚Äúvery clear,‚Äù and so on, the minds of the yogis die,

original: rtsa'i tshigs la sogs pa thams cad du rang bzhin med par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa'i tshigs la sogs pa thams cad du rang bzhin med par 'gro ba'o //
translated: that is, go to the state of essencelessness in all the joints of the channels, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la @291a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la @291a * //

original: sogs pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: sogs pa de de bzhin no //
translated: they become just like that.

original: gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas bha'i yi ge'i don gyis te /
analyzed: gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas bha'i yi ge'i don gyis te /

original: rnam pa thams cad bde ba'i bdag nyid du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad bde ba'i bdag nyid du 'gro ba ste /
translated: they go to the state of the nature of bliss in all aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpas de'i rnam par bzung bas dkyil 'khor thams cad kyang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bde ba'i rang bzhin rnams su 'gro ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de'i rnam par bzung bas dkyil 'khor thams cad kyang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bde ba'i rang bzhin rnams su 'gro ste /
translated: Since the Bodhisattva has taken up its form, all ma·πá·∏çalas and all world systems go to the nature of bliss.

original: des 'khor lo'i rim pa'i rab tu sbyor bas rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs kyi ro myong bar byed de de bzhin no //
analyzed: des 'khor lo'i rim pa'i rab tu sbyor bas rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs kyi ro myong bar byed de de bzhin no //
translated: By the application of the stages of the wheel, the Lord of Yogins experiences the taste of form, just so.

original: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
translated: And also declared:

original: dus dang dus min gnyis rnams su /
analyzed: dus dang dus min gnyis rnams su /
translated: ‚ÄúIn both timely and untimely ways,

original: 'jig rten du ni mi 'tshe ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten du ni mi 'tshe ste /
translated: one should not harm the world.

original: sdig pa mang po mi byed pa //
analyzed: sdig pa mang po mi byed pa //
translated: Not doing much that is evil,

original: mchog ni myur du 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: mchog ni myur du 'chi ba'o //
translated: the supreme one quickly dies.

original: bsod nams dbang gis byang chub tu //
analyzed: bsod nams dbang gis byang chub tu //

analyzed: 'chi'o 'chi bas bde ster 'gyur //
translated: death bestows bliss in enlightenment.

original: sems can thams cad nyer spyod pas //
analyzed: sems can thams cad nyer spyod pas //
translated: By the enjoyment of all sentient beings,

original: 'khor lo'i rnam pa rnams su 'byung //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i rnam pa rnams su 'byung //
translated: the forms of the wheel arise.

original: byang chub bde ba myang ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub bde ba myang ba ste /
translated: The taste of the bliss of enlightenment

analyzed: 'chi pa de ni 'chi bar 'gro //

analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten du gang 'chi //

analyzed: bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //

analyzed: dpal thams cad gsang pa'i le'u lnga bcu pa las dpal rdo rje 'od kyi rab tu sbyor bas 'chi ba'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid dang de'i de ltar slu ba'i ming gi yi ge la sogs pa'i rab tu sbyor ba dang de ba zhin du sangs rgyas nyid
translated: In the glorious fifty-chapter Guhyasamaja, the characteristics of the knowledge of death through the glorious Vajraprabha‚Äôs application, the application of the syllables of his name, and so on, in that way, and likewise, the various instructions for the determination of death in buddhahood,

original: du 'chi bar yongs su gzhag pa'i man ngag sna tshogs dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa rgyas par bstan pa ste rab tu byed pa bdun pa'i bshad pa'o /

original: // / rdo rje lus ni sku chen po //
analyzed: // / rdo rje lus ni sku chen po //

analyzed: lha sogs thams cad kyi gzugs can //

analyzed: kun mkhyen gzugs te rang rnam par //

analyzed: di ni rdo rje sku'i bshad pa gsungs pa /

original: de nas phyag na rdo rje sogs ;
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rje sogs ;
translated: Then, VajrapƒÅ·πái, etc.

original: / zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ste /

original: gsol ba 'debs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa gsungs pa /
translated: The request is stated:

translated: The ‚Äúking of bliss‚Äù is ≈örƒ´ Heruka, who is beautified and inflamed by bliss. ‚Äú By this‚Äù means that the glorious Vajra·∏çƒÅka, who is equal to Vajra·∏çƒÅka, and the yoginƒ´s such as VƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, are awakened.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don gyi rgyur 'dri zhing mkhyen par gsol ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don gyi rgyur 'dri zhing mkhyen par gsol ba'o //

original: kye rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma @293b thams cad gang khyed kyis 'dri ba'i dus de ni khyod nyid kyi gzugs can ni 'di'i dus te /
analyzed: kye rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma @293b thams cad gang khyed kyis 'dri ba'i dus de ni khyod nyid kyi gzugs can ni 'di'i dus te /
translated: O Vajravarahi and all the yoginis, that time which you ask about is your own form, this time.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩIt is said:

analyzed: de yang sems te thams cad du 'gro ba'i de kho na nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i sems kyi gzugs ni rnal 'byor ma rnams te sems dang po'i dngos po'o //

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /

original: sna tshogs sa bon sems chen po //
analyzed: sna tshogs sa bon sems chen po //

original: zhes bya ba ste khams gsum rnams su dngos po sna tshogs pa sems kyi gzugs nyid de 'dis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste khams gsum rnams su dngos po sna tshogs pa sems kyi gzugs nyid de 'dis bskyed pa'o //
translated: The forms of things in the three realms are the forms of mind itself, generated by this.üîΩBy the application of the sprout,

original: myu gu'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni de yang rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs rnams skye ba ste de yang gza' dang rgyu skar la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams su'o //
analyzed: myu gu'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni de yang rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs rnams skye ba ste de yang gza' dang rgyu skar la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams su'o //

analyzed: 'on kyang 'di des kun rdzob tu dus gnyis brjod de 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das ba'o //

analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gzugs med pa skad cig med pa'i bgrang ba ste dus med pa'i gzugs kyi rnal 'byor ma rnams skyes pa'o //
translated: Therein, the supramundane is the enumeration of the formless, nonmomentary, nontemporal forms of the yoginis.

original: rnal 'byor rnams kyi bde ba'i rgyus //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnams kyi bde ba'i rgyus //

original: zhes bya ba ni mchog tu zag ba med pa'i ye shes rnams su ste de de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchog tu zag ba med pa'i ye shes rnams su ste de de bzhin du bshad do //

analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten pa'i ni 'jig rten gyi rang gis so sor snang bar 'gyur ba'i dus tsam ste de de bzhin du gsungs so //

original: de'i phyar myu gu can bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyar myu gu can bsgom par bya ste /

original: sa bon zhes bya ba ni sems kyis bon gyis so //
analyzed: sa bon zhes bya ba ni sems kyis bon gyis so //

original: myu gu can ni bsam pa'o //
analyzed: myu gu can ni bsam pa'o //

analyzed: da ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyu skar dang / tshes grangs rnams kyis spyir bsdus @294a * //
